  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(String[] args)
      Demo application.
      • prints the test data using print(java.util.Collection<Onlinehandel.entities.Order>)
      • sorts them by order id
      • prints them again (sorted)
      • filters orders, keeping those that are currently collected but not delivered
      • prints the filtered orders again
      • exports the filtered orders to file orders_on_route.txt and displays the number of orders exported
      Parameters:
      args - (not used)

    • filter

      public static <T> java.util.List<T> filter​(java.util.List<T> list, Matcher<? super T> m)
      filters a collection of entities with a certain filter. a newly created list of entities containing only those that match. The entities themselves are not duplicated.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the entities
      Parameters:
      list - the original entities to filter
      m - the filter
      Returns:
      the entities that match

    • export

      public static int export​(java.util.Collection<Order> deliveries, String filename)
      Saves several orders to file. The deliveries are saved in their standard format (standard string representation) one per line. This functions does not throw any IOException, instead handles them internally, printing an error message if exporting fails.
      Parameters:
      deliveries - the deliveries to export
      filename - the name of the target file
      Returns:
      number of deliveries successfully exported.

    • print

      public static void print​(java.util.Collection<Order> deliveries)
      Prints orders line by line.

      Adds a short header before printing the String representation of all deliveries line by line. For a single delivery the standard string representation provided by Delivery.toString() is used.

      Parameters:
      deliveries - the deliveries to print.
      Hint:
      provided
